page.title: 01Gazeteer
page.content: The major part of this block is farmland with the emphasis on intensively managed grassland which is typical of much of Galloway. The area is bisected by the A713 which is the main road from Castle Douglas to Ayr. Running parallel to it is the course of the now disused railway line. The settlement pattern is a dispersed one. There is some evidence of past settlement in the area including the site of a Roman Fort at Glenlochar. The main settlement is Crossmichael which is situated on the A713 some three miles northwest of Castle Douglas. It is a small village with a couple of shops and a pub. There are council hoses and a recent private housing development in the village. There is a small watersports centre here because of the River Dee which flows through this block.
